pros: Good enviroment to work, friendly faculty and staffs.
cons: Financial problems may negatively impact growth

job_title: Professor English Writing in Brownsville, TX
pros: University of Texas at Brownasville, now UTRGV, has an excellent English Department with some of the best professors I have either studied under or taught alongside. There is an excellent collegial atmosphere in the department and professors are encouraged to you use their own original methods within the classroom structure
cons: During the last three years the university has split from its community college, merged with a large university an hour to the west, and fired over 90 teachers many of whom were tenured.

review_title: If you are looking for work, you may not want to stop here!
pros: The UT System as a whole is great.  Great health insurance and retirement benefits.  Possibility for better conditions in 2 years - if the institution survives the split it is undergoing now (summer 2013) and the plan to incorporate a medical school materializes.
cons: Unfortunately, those in charge in Brownsville have created or allowed a political hornets nest to fester.  Too many Chiefs, not enough Indians.

review_title: Great learning opportunity, but lacks organization
pros: As a student or recent graduate this place is a good job opportunity. You get to learn from peers who have been in the field for some time and have some guidance with projects. This is a great opportunity to get experience.
cons: Most of the projects I was involved in were disorganized, and the ultimate goal was to make things work. I would have preferred a more structured project plan.

review_title: During Times of Change - The Management Takes Care of Themselves
pros: In my home town - and senior worker.
cons: Management looks out for themselves with high salaries and lets the workers fend for themselves by decreasing jobs, not growing the business.

review_title: Good for new grads in tech field
pros:
- Flexible, and relaxed environment
- Interesting projects (wide range of projects)
cons: - Under staffed (great because you learn more) but sometimes is difficult to meet deadlines

review_title: Great experience working as an L2S tutor!
pros: Working with students and getting to see the immediate impact of your work.
cons: Lots of bureaucracy such as meetings and paperwork

review_title: Great learning experience while finishing degree
job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Brownsville, TX
cons: Micromanagement, some people act smarter than they will ever be

pros: Network with many different people, good opportunity for career growth
cons: Must also have high degree most of the time for promotion

pros: Great Environment, Understanding student's needs, beautiful campus and good atmosphere.
cons: Do more with less is a constant feeling.
